articles.title: Why Snow Squall Alerts Set Off Phones Around New York
articles.description: New Yorkers were jolted on Wednesday with back-to-back phone alerts about powerful bursts of snow and wind hitting the area.
articles.content:
Cellphones around the New York region began buzzing with an emergency alert from the National Weather Service at 3:30 p.m. on Wednesday: Snow Squall Warning til 4:15 p.m. EST. Sudden whiteouts. Icy Roads. Slow Down!
